definition: Mainland Affairs Council (Taiwan), abbr. for 大陸委員會|大陆委员会
same as 逶 in 逶迤 winding, curved
to entrust/to cast aside/to shift (blame etc)/to accumulate/roundabout/winding/dejected/listless/committee member/council/end/actually/certainly
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: MAC, we won't be developing on PCs or any other devices.
sentences.chinese: 陸委會，我們不會開發PC或任何其他設備。

sentences.english: When the Soviets arrive, Mac reveals that he lied about being a double agent.
sentences.chinese: 當蘇聯抵達，陸委會透露，他說謊是一個雙重間諜。

sentences.english: A representative for the Mainland Affairs Council said that the CSECC will meet twice a year.
sentences.chinese: 陸委會代表表示兩岸經合會每年將召開兩次會議。

definition: Straits Exchange Foundation (SEF), semi-official organization established by the ROC government in Taiwan
Association for Relations Across the Taiwan Straits (ARATS)/abbr. for 海峽兩岸關係協會|海峡两岸关系协会[Hai3 xia2 Liang3 an4 Guan1 xi5 Xie2 hui4]
Chen Chien-jen (1951-), Taiwanese politician, vice president of the Republic of China 2016-2020
Chen Shui-Bian (1950-), Taiwanese DPP 民進黨|民进党 politician, president of the Republic of China 2000-2008
Ma Ying-jeou (1950-), Taiwanese Kuomintang politician, Mayor of Taipei 1998-2006, president of Republic of China 2008-2016
social movement/abbr. for 社會運動|社会运动
Lee Teng-hui (1923-2020), Taiwanese politician, president of ROC 1988-2000
full-time/to appoint sb to a specific task
